Do not have an account? Signup
Please enter your email address to request a password reset.

Provides facility to send instant emergency/SOS messages to your family members and get alarm messages through notifications. This app helps to find nearby emergency service providers by using GPS tracking.
Helps you to find nearby emergency services providers around your locality.
Provides you the precautionary steps to be taken during emergency/disasters and the first aid/ primary steps to be provided to the patients during emergency/disasters.
Provides you the facility to send SOS messages to the family members/recipients by using social media(WhatsApp). At first, you have to create a new broadcast on WhatsApp to send messages.
Already have a broadcast? Leave it
•\If you\'re outdoors, stay in the open away from power lines or anything that might fall. Stay away from buildings (stuff might fall off the building or the building could fall on you).
•\Don\'t use matches, candles, or any flame. Broken gas lines and fire don\'t mix.
•\If you\'re in a car, stop the car and stay inside the car until the earthquake stops.
•\Heed evacuation warnings. If there is any possibility of a flash flood, move immediately to higher ground.
•\If possible, bring in outdoor furniture and move important items to an upper floor, above possible flood levels.
•\Do not walk through flooded areas. It can be difficult to tell how deep the water is and what lies underneath the water that could hurt you. Even shallow, moving water can make you fall.
•\If you have to walk in water, wherever possible, walk where the water is not moving. Use a stick to check the firmness of the ground in front of you.
• Azithromycin(for Children and Pregnant Woman in Severe Case).
•\Never cross a road with water or mud flowing. Never cross a bridge if you see a flow approaching. It can grow faster and larger too quickly for you to escape.
• For all snake bites, provide emergency care including cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) if needed.
• Avoid washing the bite area because any venom left on the skin can help identify the snake.
• Apply a pressure immobilisation bandage and keep the person calm and as still as possible until medical help arrives.
1. Cover the wound with a gauze or a cloth.
2. Apply direct pressure to stop the blood flow
3. Don\'t remove the cloth. Add more layers if needed. The cloth will help clots form to stop the flow.
1. Flush the burned area with cool running water for several minutes. Do not use ice.
3. Do not apply ointments, butter, or oily remedies to the burn.
4. Take ibuprofen or acetaminophen for pain relief if necessary
1. Use a sterilized needle and make small punctures at the edge of the blister.
4. Cover it to protect it from further rubbing and pressure.
2. Stabilize the limb using a splint and padding to keep it immobile.
3. Put a cold pack on the injury, avoiding placing ice directly on the skin.
2. Pinch the nose just below the bridge. Don\'t pinch the nostrils closed by pinching lower.
3. Check after five minutes to see if bleeding has stopped. If not, continue pinching and check after another 10 minutes.
4. You can also apply a cold pack to the bridge of the nose while pinching.
1. Get the stinger out any way you can to prevent more venom being delivered. It\'s a myth that any particular way is better or worse.
2. If the person is known to be allergic to bee stings, use an EpiPen to prevent anaphylaxis or call 911 if none is available.
"3. Use a cold pack to reduce swelling at the site, but take care not to cause frostbite. "
"4. Use an antihistamine like Benadryl (diphenhydramine) to reduce swelling and itching. "
